abstract.p: Bank of England and European Central Bank leave interest rates unchanged at their regular policy-making meetings, reflecting continued divergence between British and euro-zone economies; for sixth consecutive month, Bank of England holds benchmark rate at 6 percent; European Central Bank holds rate at 4.25 perecnt (S)

block.p: The Bank of England and the European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at their regular policy-making meetings, reflecting continued divergence between the British and euro-zone economies. For the sixth consecutive month, the Bank of England held its benchmark rate at 6 percent. In Frankfurt, the European Central Bank maintained its benchmark rate at 4.25 percent. The decisions were expected, but economists expect both central banks to raise rates later this year.

The Bank of England and the European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged at their regular policy-making meetings, reflecting continued divergence between the British and euro-zone economies. For the sixth consecutive month, the Bank of England held its benchmark rate at 6 percent. In Frankfurt, the European Central Bank maintained its benchmark rate at 4.25 percent. The decisions were expected, but economists expect both central banks to raise rates later this year.
Alan Cowell WORLD BUSINESS BRIEFING: EUROPE
